alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 6:51PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following county, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 815 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 651 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... South Fork Republican River, Big Sandy Creek, Dugout Creek, Sevenmile Creek, Lake Creek and Hell Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Limon and Genoa.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland along creeks, and other low lying areas.
